recipe.title: Mushroom & Leek Stroganof

inspiration.text: Mushroom Leek Stroganoff recipe by Nisha Vora

recipe.ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil, divided into 1 tbsp each 2 leeks, cleaned, trimmed, sliced 4 cloves garlic, minced 350g mushrooms, sliced 1 tsp dried thyme 1 tsp salt, divided and more to season 375mL vegetable broth 2 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp vegan Worcestershire sauce (optional) 30g all purpose flour (or 2tbsp cornstarch) ½ cup dry white wine (pinot grigio or sauvignon blanc) 400mL full fat coconut milk 2 tbsp tahini 2 tbsp nutritional yeast 1 tsp paprika ½ tsp dijon mustard We served with pan fried crisp kale

method.step: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Once oil is shimmering, add leeks and saute for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly brown.

Add the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, along with garlic, mushrooms, and thyme. Stir to combine. Saute for 4-5 min or until mushrooms are lightly browned and tender. Add ½ tsp salt and cook for one more minute
While mushrooms are cooking, mix vegetable broth, soy sauce, worcestershire sauce (optional), and flour (or cornstarch) in a measuring cup or bowl, whisking to combine
Pour the vegetable broth-flour mixture into the pot and whisk to combine, ensuring there are no flour clumps. Bring to a simmer.
Pour in the white wine with the cooked mushrooms and allow to simmer for 3 min or until the smell of alcohol has dissipated.
Pour in coconut milk, tahini, nutritional yeast, the remaining ½ tsp salt, and paprika. Bring to simmer over medium-low heat. Cook for 10 minutes until the sauce is thickened and very creamy.
Stir in dijon mustard and taste for seasonings, adding more salt if needed. Garnish with parsley and vegan parmesan if desired.
